pageContext.description: A copper-alloy, Bronze Age chisel of middle Bronze Age date, circa 1500-1150 BC. The chisel is tanged rather than socketed, though part of the tang appears to have been broken off in antiquity. Between the tang and the blade there is a stop ridge. After the stop ridge the blade flares gradually towards the edge.  The chisel has the familiar dark green patina associated with artefacts of Bronze Age date, though it is in poor condition and some of the patina is flaking away. The thin tip of the blade is in particularly fragmentary condition. The chisel measures 71.8 mm in length, is 4.6 mm in thickness and flares from 5.9 mm to 26.3 mm thick from the tang to the blade. It weighs 27.34 grams.
